definition: to yield to force
classifier for medicine: dose/Taiwan pr. [fu2]

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
hard/stiff/strong/firm/resolutely/doggedly/good (quality)/able (person)/(of food) filling/substantial

sentences.english: It is said that many people are serving hard against soft.
sentences.chinese: 这是说，许多人都是服硬不服软的。

definition: susceptible to force but not persuasion
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
lit. eats soft food, but refuses hard food (idiom)/amenable to coaxing but not coercion
a wise man knows better than to fight when the odds are against him (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 han4 bu4 chi1 yan3 qian2 kui1

definition: can bow and submit, or can stand tall (idiom, from Book of Changes); ready to give and take/flexible
miserable wretch/contemptible individual
A leader can submit or can stand tall as required./ready to give and take/flexible
pinyin: da4 zhang4 fu5 neng2 qu1 neng2 shen1

definition: lit. to climb all over sb/fig. to take advantage of sb's weakness
to retort/to answer back
garrulous and sharp-tongued
Only an outstanding talent can recognize current trends (idiom). A wise man submits to circumstances.
pinyin: shi2 shi2 wu4 zhe3 wei4 jun4 jie2

definition: annoying person/troublemaker/pain in the neck
can bow and submit, or can stand tall (idiom, from Book of Changes); ready to give and take/flexible
unmoved by force or persuasion
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
